basic_info.description: Hello! I'm Chien, a Deaf developer whose native language is Vietnamese Sign Language (VSL). I have a passion for working with computers, from researching new cloud trends, learning new technologies, to exploring ways to integrate logic and communication. As a Cloud Engineer, I specialize in designing, developing, and managing cloud-based computing systems. I have a solid understanding of the technical aspects of cloud computing and hands-on experience with AWS, where I design, implement, and maintain cloud-based solutions. My DevOps experience includes CI/CD, Docker, and managing Linux servers and microservices architectures. I am skilled in relational and non-relational database analysis, design, and administration using MySQL, MariaDB, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, and Firebase. I am a proactive, self-taught, and innovative professional, adaptable in communicating and collaborating effectively with teams and clients through technology. I am committed to delivering high-quality solutions, leveraging my analytical and problem-solving skills. I am passionate about software development, sharing knowledge, and implementing digital solutions for successful project delivery.

projects.title: Animal Shelter
projects.description: The most extensive application I had the opportunity to work on. I learned a lot of technologies and my code was reviewed by a great mentor. The application handles all adoption processes and allows for storing all documentation related to the adoption of animals from the shelter.

projects.title: Photography
projects.description: Personal project for a university course. I was responsible for testing an application that optimizes photos using popular algorithms used by graphic editors like Pixlr or Adobe Photoshop. I received an A for this project :)

projects.title: 3D Object Viewer
projects.description: One of the first applications I worked on during my internship. I had to prepare the front-end for an application that displays 3D models of famous buildings. This was also my first project using the Angular framework. I learned a lot!
